SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.ckd

Interface Drugs

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlTokenSource
All Known Implementing Classes:
DrugsImpl
public interface Drugs extends org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject
Drug configuration interface for CKD medication management. This XMLBeans-generated interface manages the collection of medications relevant to CKD patient care. It includes both contraindicated drugs (nephrotoxic medications to avoid) and recommended medications for CKD treatment protocols. The drug list serves multiple clinical purposes: - Identifying nephrotoxic medications that require dose adjustment or avoidance - Tracking ACE inhibitors and ARBs for renoprotective therapy - Managing phosphate binders and other CKD-specific medications - Supporting drug interaction checking in the context of reduced renal clearance - Guiding prescribing decisions based on eGFR levels Common CKD-relevant drug categories include: - NSAIDs (generally contraindicated) - Metformin (requires dose adjustment based on eGFR) - ACE inhibitors/ARBs (renoprotective but require monitoring) - Phosphate binders (for hyperphosphatemia management) - Erythropoiesis-stimulating agents (for anemia management)
Since:
2010-01-01

  • Method Details

    • getDrugArray

      String[] getDrugArray()
      Gets all configured drugs as an array. Returns the complete list of medications relevant to CKD management. Each drug entry typically contains the medication name, ATC code, or other identifying information used by the prescribing system.
      Returns:
      String[] array of all configured drug identifiers

    • getDrugArray

      String getDrugArray(int p0)
      Gets a specific drug by index. Retrieves a single drug identifier from the collection at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index of the drug to retrieve
      Returns:
      String drug identifier at the specified index
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xgetDrugArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] xgetDrugArray()
      Gets all drugs as XML string objects. Returns the drug collection as XMLBeans XmlString objects, providing access to full XML type information.
      Returns:
      XmlString[] array of drugs with XML type information

    • xgetDrugArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString xgetDrugArray(int p0)
      Gets a specific drug as XML string by index. Retrieves a single drug as an XmlString object with full XML type information.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index of the drug
      Returns:
      XmlString drug with XML type information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • sizeOfDrugArray

      int sizeOfDrugArray()
      Gets the number of drugs in the collection. Returns the total count of configured medications.
      Returns:
      int number of drugs configured

    • setDrugArray

      void setDrugArray(String[] p0)
      Sets the entire drug array. Replaces all existing drug entries with the provided array. This completely overwrites the current drug configuration.
      Parameters:
      p0 - String[] array of drug identifiers to set

    • setDrugArray

      void setDrugArray(int p0, String p1)
      Sets a specific drug at an index. Updates or replaces the drug at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index where to set the drug
      p1 - String drug identifier to set
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xsetDrugArray

      void xsetDrugArray(org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] p0)
      Sets the entire drug array using XML strings. Replaces all drugs using XmlString objects with type information.
      Parameters:
      p0 - XmlString[] array of drugs with XML type information

    • xsetDrugArray

      void xsetDrugArray(int p0, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString p1)

      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index where to set the drug
      p1 - XmlString drug with XML type information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • insertDrug

      void insertDrug(int p0, String p1)
      Inserts a drug at a specific index. Inserts a new drug at the specified position, shifting existing drugs to make room.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index for insertion
      p1 - String drug identifier to insert

    • addDrug

      void addDrug(String p0)
      Adds a drug to the collection. Appends a new drug identifier to the end of the drug list.
      Parameters:
      p0 - String drug identifier to add

    • insertNewDrug

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString insertNewDrug(int p0)
      Inserts a new empty drug at a specific index. Creates and inserts a new XmlString at the specified position. The returned instance can be populated with drug information.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index for insertion
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created drug entry

    • addNewDrug

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString addNewDrug()
      Adds a new empty drug to the collection. Creates and appends a new XmlString to the drug list. The returned instance can be configured with drug details.
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created drug entry

    • removeDrug

      void removeDrug(int p0)
      Removes a drug at a specific index. Deletes the drug at the specified position, shifting remaining drugs to fill the gap.
      Parameters:
      p0 - int zero-based index of the drug to remove
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid
